842641975:
[

Sales Coordinator

Company Name Hub Furniture Lighting Living Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 25 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

We are seeking a warm, vibrant and diligent individual with a passion for furniture, design and the highest levels of customer service to join our team. The role is a full time position with the opportunity to develop a professional career within the Architectural & Design industry. As a market leader in the furniture design industry you will have the opportunity to work alongside Australia's leading Architects and Interior Designers.


Since its inception, the driving force behind Hub has been to inspire and share beautiful design. Hub is made up of 45 talented and driven individuals, each one dynamic, passionate and integral in this cohesive organisation. At Hub we carefully cultivate and nurture our Hub spirit with coaching, personal and professional development and an inclusive team environment.


The role is a full-time position based in our flagship showroom in Abbotsford and you will be an integral part of the Retail team. Our commitment is to grow and nurture our employees to achieve our business goals and provide the highest level of client service. We offer comprehensive training with ongoing coaching and support in an open and friendly environment.


Desired skills & experience


  • A passion for high end design and the interiors / architecture industry
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication
  • A willing, can-do attitude
  • Highly organised and self-motivated
  • Able to apply a common sense commercial approach to problem solving
  • Exceptional attention to detail
  • Ability to work in a team environment and autonomously
  • Have sound knowledge of Microsoft Office
  • Available to work Saturdays
  • Must have the right to live and work in Australia


Primary responsibilities


  • Meet and greet clients in the Showroom
  • Maintaining high standards of presentation
  • Act as direct support to a Sales Consultant
  • Prepare/ assist with design drawings, client presentations and pricing information.
  • Processing, receiving and tracking orders
  • Raise, complete and send invoices
  • Enter, update and maintain customer information
  • Directly liaise with high end clients via phone, face-to-face, and emailing
  • Liaise on a daily basis with international suppliers


What we offer


  • Competitive pay rates & attractive commission structure
  • Great staff discount across our products
  • Recognition and rewards for outstanding performance
  • Excellent training and professional development
  • A vibrant, fast paced and fun work environment within a supportive team.
  • Career potential & growth


About us


Hub Furniture Lighting Living is a privately-owned company with showrooms and offices in Melbourne & Sydney. We are proud to represent the best international brands exclusively in the Australian marketplace. We pride ourselves on our spirit and approachable manner and always strive to improve on our established benchmark.


If this is you, apply now by sending your CV and one paragraph as to why you think you would be a perfect candidate to careers@hubfurniture.com.au \xa0 \xa0


www.hubfurniture.com.au

842633310:
[

Senior Digital Producer

Company Name The Natives - Design, Marketing & Technology Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 38 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Natives are on the hunt for a highly talented Digital Producer to deliver our digital projects. We are a young, fun and rapidly growing digitally-led creative agency situated in Cremorne. Coming off the back of a fantastic year we are looking for someone to help us take it to the next level.


We specialise in working with the eCommerce, product design and property sectors, as well as with start-ups, which puts us right at the heart of creating new and exciting digital experiences.

As Digital Producer you will ensure all websites/platforms and campaigns, are managed and delivered successfully, and to the highest standards, whether you are producing the project yourself or assisting other members of the team with their projects. You are in charge of ensuring our projects go that extra 10%, even if no one thought it was possible.

Reporting directly to the Managing Director, you will have a real influence on the efficiency and output of the agency. We have processes in place but we need you onboard to help us refine them and to make the most of our super-talented team.


We are offering an attractive salary based on experience and a bonus.

Requirements & skills:


  • Attention to detail.

  • Managing detailed timelines, WIPs and allocating resources

  • Taking briefs from clients and developing project plans

  • Liaising with all members of the digital team including copywriters, social media managers, designers and developers

  • Ensure all digital productions are highly successful from a creative, financial and delivery perspective

  • Ability to communicate technical solutions to non-technical clients and stakeholders

  • Ability to manage multiple web builds at once

  • A strong understanding of the Digital landscape - SEO/SEM, Data/Analytics, CRM/CMS, eDMs and Automation.

  • Ability to manage resource pipelines for all projects

  • Writing project scopes and other documentation

  • Managing website and platform projects including research, UX, design and development stages.

  • Technical competence of CMS in particular Wordpress, Laravel and eCommerce platforms.

  • Experience with BitBucket, Pipelines and basic deployment practices highly favoured.

  • Actively engaging and nurturing best-in-class creative partners and specialist vendors to ensure high-quality digital productions from both a design and technical implementation standpoint

  • Ability to communicate technical solutions to non-technical clients and stakeholders

  • Experience with, project management software (Asana), processes, budgets, quoting and time tracking

  • 3+ years experience in an agency or studio environment

  • Banter and a good sense of humour with a proactive attitude



To apply, please send your CV and cover letter to tom@thenatives.com.au. No recruiters thanks.

Domestic Sales Executive

Company Name Melbourne Star Observation Wheel Company Location Docklands, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 52 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Do you want to be part of the team driving tourism visitation to our iconic fixture in the beautiful Melbourne skyline? This could be your chance to really shine.


Melbourne Star is a complete experience, giving guests a new way to engage with our vibrant cityscape. We are one of only a handful of giant Observation Wheels in the World - the only one of its kind in the Southern Hemisphere.


We're currently searching for a talented tourism individual with a passion for and understanding of the domestic market coupled with a natural flair for sales.


Your key focus will be on achieving increased visitation numbers from the domestic market; and will require:


  • Building an extensive network of relationships with various entities,
  • Liaising with domestic wholesalers, education partners, day tour companies and O.T.A.’s,
  • Assisting in activations and promotional activities.


Our ideal Star will have:


  • A background in tourism and understanding of the domestic market segment,
  • A sound knowledge of domestic wholesalers, O.T.A.’s and the education segment,
  • A natural knack and aptitude for sales,
  • Top-tier communication skills (written and verbal),
  • An ingrained passion for tourism,
  • The drive and tenacity to receive a ‘no’ and keep pushing on,
  • Professionalism and integrity that are second nature.


We are offering a full time role in a supportive team environment and the chance to make your mark in the domestic sector. You must be organised, thrive in a fast paced environment and team focussed.


We welcome your application.

839548965:
[

Financial Accountant

Company Name Elenium Automation Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 136 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Financial Accountant


  • State of the Art Technology Company to the Aviation Sector;
  • Excellent Career Opportunity;
  • Join our Dynamic, Fast Paced & Friendly Team.


About the Company

Elenium Automation, a local Melbourne based Technology Company, develops, manufactures and supports innovative self-service and automation technologies for airports and airlines. Our bespoke automated bag drops, boarding gates and self-check-in kiosks are used in international airports across the globe. We are a dynamic, growing business that has built a reputation in providing our clients with cutting edge technologies, which moves people faster. Our desire is to reduce queues, drive operational efficiency and deliver a better customer experience.

Based in our Head office in Tullamarine, an excellent career opportunity exists for a proactive, CA/CPA qualified professional who has a strong desire to contribute and participate in the exciting opportunities arising within a dynamic, growing, technology business with growth and expansion plans.


The Role

Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer, and overseeing a small team, you will be hands on and accountable for a broad range of finance, management and administration accounting functions.


Your key challenges include:


  • Working closely with the Chief Financial Officer and senior management to implement accounting policies, procedures and financial controls systems to support the company’s growth plans.
  • Overseeing and ensuring the accuracy of accounts receivable and payable transaction requirements.
  • Cash flow management, forecasting and reporting to senior management.
  • Overseeing processing of monthly payroll.
  • Preparation of statutory returns – BAS, Payroll Tax and FBT.
  • Assisting with preparing month end reporting and year-end statutory accounts.
  • Maintaining the company’s fixed asset register.
  • Analysing and reporting to key stakeholders regarding operational performance and \xa0work with the business to implement and report against KPI’s.
  • Partnering with cross-functional teams and maintaining strong relationships with a range of key stakeholders including: banking institutions, suppliers and external auditors etc.

\xa0\xa0

Experience and Skills:

  • Must be an Australian/N.Z. Citizen or have Permanent Residency. Official documentation is required.
  • CA/CPA qualifications are essential.
  • A background in financial and management accounting together with hands on leadership experience in a similar role, from within a manufacturing, technology, automation, SME environment or other relevant industries will be looked upon favourably.
  • Intermediate to advanced skills in MS Excel is essential.
  • Proficient with the use of an SME accounting software. MYOB software accounting experience is essential.
  • Experience in an ERP environment will be well regarded.
  • You must have strong communications skills and an ability to work with a range of key stakeholders.
  • A flexible team player and able to work autonomously.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
  • An ability to prioritise work requirements and work towards tight deadlines.


What is On Offer? \xa0

  • An attractive salary package will be negotiated to attract the most suitable candidate for this role.
  • We are offering an excellent career opportunity to contribute and participate, in a dynamic, growing, leading-edge technology business, with growth and expansion plans.
  • Elenium has a strong commitment to its people and their development and offers a fast paced, supportive team environment.
  • Complimentary lunch is provided on Friday!


To be considered for this exciting opportunity, applications including a cover letter and resume should be directed to: Vicki Aisen, Human Resources Manager, Elenium Automation at vicki.aisen@elenium.com.\xa0\xa0A copy of a Permanent Resident Grant Notice (if applicable) or Australian/N.Z. citizenship will be needed to proceed.


Please refer to our company website at www.elenium.com. \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0

839541677:
[

Senior Global Equities Analyst – Tech Sector

Company Name Ellerston Capital Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 188 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Exciting new opportunity within a high-profile brand
  • Absolute return focus
  • Global small-mid caps

\xa0

Ellerston Capital Limited is a multi-billion dollar Sydney and Melbourne based bespoke investment manager that has been managing funds since 2004. The company is majority owned by principals and employees and specialises in equity strategies with a high conviction, bottom up, benchmark independent investment approach.

\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0

Ellerston Capital currently manages a number of strategies including global long short, concentrated long only, small and micro capitalisation Australian equities, Australian market neutral, Asian long only, global macro, and private equity. Their client base includes leading sovereign, industry and corporate superannuation funds, as well as high net worth individuals and retail investors.

\xa0

The Ellerston Global Investment team targets small-mid cap companies across the US, Europe and Japan. As an active investment manager, they are a high conviction in strategy and boutique in culture.


As a Senior Global Equities Analyst, you will be focused on bespoke global analysis across multiple sectors to identify new investment opportunities. You will have access to key investment professionals and will enjoy interaction and where appropriate, guidance from credible industry experts. Further key accountabilities will include identifying money-making investment opportunities which will contribute to fund performance, analysing and assessing industry structures and company strategies and forming views on future outcomes for returns on capital. Analysts will also clearly and succinctly articulate their views with clarity. Applicants of interest are those who exercise astute critical thinking in their daily decision making and enjoy rigorous investment debate.


Ideal candidates will have between 5-8 years’ experience as an equity analyst and will bring existing experience covering technology stocks. Furthermore, you will exhibit sound financial modelling skills and hold strong tertiary qualifications in economics, finance or commerce. That experience may be from offshore or locally as an equity analyst. A passion for company analysis and a history of investment is essential, as is inner drive and determination. \xa0


To explore further in confidence, please send a covering letter and CV (in Word format) detailing your suitability for the opportunity to: meredith.jordan@platinumpacificpartners.com.au

839315576:
[

Senior Construction/Utilities Lawyer 8+ PQE, Melbourne

Company Name Dovetail Legal Solutions Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 12 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Construction/Utilities Lawyer 8+ PQE, Melbourne

– Responsibility for the legal function of a business division

– Engagement with executive and board level decision makers

– Leading infrastructure company

– Excellent remuneration

A rare opportunity for a senior lawyer to join a blue chip, international infrastructure company. This role offers the right lawyer as much autonomy and ownership as they are capable of handling – you will be responsible for the legal function for a specific division of their business. The division for which you will be responsible is well established, has recently won several large projects, with more on the horizon and has been growing quickly. This role would be ideal for a lawyer looking to make a move from a similar senior role but looking for more autonomy and experience with larger projects or a capable lawyer looking to push themselves and take a step up.

\xa0

The legal team that you will join is friendly, collaborative and at the top of their game, and while you will have their support you will be expected to manage your own workload and the legal function for the division.

\xa0

\xa0About you:-

  • 8 + years’ PQE as including in-house experience within a construction and/or infrastructure and/or utilities team
  • Able to work autonomously and inform and influence senior stakeholders
  • You will be expected to present confidently and clearly to senior executive and board members both nationally and internationally
  • Able to work in a fast paced and often unstructured environment
  • Prepared to ‘roll up your sleeves’ where required
  • Willingness to integrate into the team quickly to ensure value is delivered to the wider business
  • Ability to communicate with all levels of the business – awareness of audience
  • Capacity to relate to the drivers of others and accommodate them within your broader strategy and communication
  • While politically astute you are not a political player – the legal team are decent and straightforward operators and they expect you to be the same

The Role:-

  • Leading global infrastructure company working on some of Australia’s largest projects
  • Supporting the sales team, work delivery and corporate advice when required;
  • Working with tender teams to formulate tender winning strategies;
  • Identifying substantial risks and assisting project teams in developing strategies that address the risks;
  • Reviewing, finalising and advising upon miscellaneous contract documents including services contracts, joint venture agreements, alliance contracts, confidentiality agreements, probity and process deeds, disclosure agreements and teaming agreements; and
  • Providing operational support to the business, including attendance at key project review meetings, meetings of business senior leaders and attendance at site when necessary.

\xa0

On Offer

  • Varied and interesting work within a collaborative and supportive legal team
  • Excellent remuneration package
  • Blue chip international organisation
  • Access to executive and board level decision makers
  • Support a well-established and fast-growing business division
  • Autonomy and ownership for the legal function of the division

\xa0

Next Steps:

If you would like to explore this opportunity further, then please click the “Apply” button and we will be in touch shortly. If you would like to have a confidential conversation first, please feel free to contact Tomas Atkins at Dovetail Legal Solutions, tomas.atkins@dovetaillaw.com.au
